decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. It aims to close out the game quickly by utilizing aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrade to keep the opponent's board in check. Overall, the deck's key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This UW Control deck focuses on board control and tempo manipulation through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats of its own, ultimately grinding out value and outlasting the opponent. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional synergy and benefits for the deck's creatures. The deck also features a mix of utility lands and spells to ensure flexibility and resilience in various matchups.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly and aggressively cast spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on using low-cost spells like Lightning Axe, Fiery Impulse, and Opt to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, while also taking advantage of card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Consider to maintain resources. The inclusion of Temporal Trespass and Picklock Prankster adds additional ways to cast spells and generate value. This deck aims to outpace the opponent with a combination of spell-slinging and creature recursion.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive green creatures while utilizing devotion to green to ramp up mana production. The key concept is to quickly generate mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Leyline of the Guildpact, allowing you to play powerful creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll early in the game. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner helps to draw extra cards and untap mana sources, further accelerating your game plan. Storm the Festival and Invasion of Ixalan provide additional ways to search for your key creatures and spells while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on using the Greasefang Parhelion combo to create a powerful board presence and win condition. The deck includes cards that support the combo by enabling card draw, protection, and removal spells to control the board. It aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck's main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to secure victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on using fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of damage through creatures like Questing Druid and Emberheart Challenger, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the way and deal direct damage. The deck utilizes efficient creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards and maximize casting Arclight Phoenix as early as possible. Using a combination of spells and card draw effects, the deck aims to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The inclusion of various direct damage spells also helps control the board and remove any threats the opponent may have. Overall, the deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and efficient card cycling to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with Spirit creatures, utilizing cards like Rattlechains, Skyclave Apparition, Supreme Phantom, and Spell Queller to apply pressure and control the opponent's board. It also includes some utility cards to protect key creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies. The mana base is designed to support the aggro strategy with a mix of lands that provide colored mana and utility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive spirit creatures while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing efficient creatures like Voice of Resurgence and Skyclave Apparition, along with mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Collected Company allows the deck to generate additional threats quickly, while cards like Enduring Innocence and Werefox Bodyguard help to maintain board control. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Retraction Helix in combination with cards like Stock Up and Thundertrap Trainer to generate powerful synergies and card advantage. By incorporating other cards like Sleight of Hand and Rona, Herald of Invasion, this deck aims to create a cohesive strategy around bouncing and replaying key cards for maximum value. With a solid base of Island lands and additional support from cards like Mox Amber and Mutavault, this deck is designed to execute its combo game plan efficiently and effectively in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck utilizes powerful creatures such as Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent and close out the game. Additionally, the deck has cards like Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber to generate card advantage and maintain control of the game. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through resource management and control elements.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with consistent pressure and damage. The key strategy revolves around leveraging spells like Sleight of Hand and Treasure Cruise to dig for Arclight Phoenix, while also utilizing removal spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to control the board and maintain tempo. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Torch the Tower and Into the Flood Maw for added versatility and disruption, making it a potent aggro deck in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, coupled with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck's strategy is to apply pressure early in the game and maintain a steady stream of threats to force the opponent on the defensive, ultimately leading to victory through sheer aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and put pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck aims to utilize creatures with haste and efficient removal spells to control the battlefield and deal damage quickly. By playing aggressively and efficiently, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory before they can stabilize. The key strategy is to maintain a steady flow of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan through removal spells and combat tricks.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, combined with powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Questing Druid to provide additional threats and ramp up mana production. Overall, the strategy revolves around applying early pressure and maintaining board control to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate massive value. It includes various support cards to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's board. The mana base is carefully curated to ensure consistency and support the deck's game plan. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to handle opposing threats and ensure the combo can be executed smoothly. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies and secure victory through a strong board presence and efficient combo execution.
